001package org.apache.turbine.services;
002
003import org.apache.logging.log4j.LogManager;
004import org.apache.logging.log4j.Logger;
005

024
025import org.apache.turbine.annotation.AnnotationProcessor;
026import org.apache.turbine.util.TurbineException;
027
028/**
029 * <p>This class provides a <code>Service</code> implementation that
030 * Services used in Turbine are required to extend. 
031 * This class provides the ability to process field annotation {@link TurbineServices} in a Turbine service.
032 * You could enable scanning globally by annotating the class (service) with the annotation {@link TurbineServices}.
033 * Field annotation could then be omitted, if the field class is {@link TurbineServices} annotated.
034 * </p>
035 *
036 */
037public abstract class FieldAnnotatedTurbineBaseService
038        extends TurbineBaseService
039{
040    
041    private static Logger log = LogManager.getLogger(FieldAnnotatedTurbineBaseService.class);
042    /**
043     * Performs late initialization.
044     *
045     * If your class relies on early initialization, and the object it
046     * expects was not received, you can use late initialization to
047     * throw an exception and complain.
048     *
049     * @throws InitializationException if initialization of this
050     * class was not successful.
051     */
052    @Override
053    public void init() throws InitializationException
054    {
055        try {
056            log.debug("parsing annotations for {}", this.getClass());
057            AnnotationProcessor.process(this, false);
058        } catch (TurbineException e) {
059            throw new InitializationException(e.getMessage(), e);
060        }
061        setInit(true);
062    }
063}
